image.altText: A black and white camera image of a driver holding a phone with a cat in their lap

props.synopsis: Thousands of drivers continue to be caught on camera using their phones while at the wheel in SA, including one man who allegedly racked up fines of more than $27,000, with police warning that smart watches could also soon be in their sights.

title.children: Driver caught 41 times by mobile phone detection cameras racks up $27,000 in fines, police say

image.altText: A lady working on a car

props.synopsis: Despite knowing she was a female from a very young age, 53-year-old mechanic Kelli Bennier only accepted herself as a transgender woman a few years ago.Â

title.children: What it's like being a transgender mechanic in a small city

image.altText: man and woman smile at camera among vineyard

props.synopsis: The wine industry's peak body hopes it can attract the next generation of growers and producers, but young, first-generation winemakers say nepotism and historical industry connections are barriers to entry.

title.children: One of the world's largest wine industries is facing an aging problem

image.altText: An SA Police officer in uniform.

props.synopsis: Police have described a sequence of fatal crashes as "truly heartbreaking" and have charged a young man with four counts of causing harm by dangerous driving over a crash that has left an 18-year-old woman in a critical condition.

title.children: Driver charged over crash that left 18yo in critical condition, after four deaths on SA roads

image.altText: A truck hits a car parked on the street.

props.synopsis: A road train driver from Western Australia will face court over a crash at the electorate office of SA state MP Tony Piccolo, where a truck ripped down the verandah and ploughed into parked cars.

title.children: Truck wrecks front of SA MP's electorate office, police arrest driver

image.altText: A woman stands in a garden holding a basket of vegetables. She wears a blue dress.

props.synopsis: Amid the chaos of motherhood and everyday life, two mums find solace and healing in their gardens.

title.children: Two mums 'grow through what they go through' with veggie patches

image.altText: A red header moves along a paddock harvesting grain with a truck following behind.

props.synopsis: South Australian farmers have grappled with a series of uncontrollable weather conditions that have created one of the most challenging seasons on record.

title.children: South Australian farmers count their losses after worst season in decades

image.altText: Chris Dyke is the man behind what's thought to be the first professional dance production choreographed by a person living with Downs Syndrome

props.synopsis: Dance has given Chris Dyke a way to connect since he was a kid. He's now making history by taking his passion to the big stage.Â

title.children: Chris Dyke is first Australian with Down syndrome to direct professional dance show

image.altText: older man smiling at sunset

props.synopsis: Coffs Harbour father-of-four Jim Auld was killed when his light plane crashed in northern NSW.

title.children: Pilot killed in Yamba plane crash remembered as 'dedicated' family man

image.altText: Katie Boulter celebrates defeating Nadia Podoroska at the United Cup.

props.synopsis: Great Britain defeats Argentina 2-1 at the United Cup in Sydney, while Jordan Thompson fights back to beat Matteo Berrettini in three sets at the Brisbane International. Follow live.

title.children: Brits down Argentina at United Cup, Aussie Thompson wins in Brisbane

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Brisbane International: Number two seed gets through
United Cup: Kazakhstan clinches 3-0 win over Greece
Canberra International: Aussie Hule completes upset win

image.altText: Chanel looking at her X-rays outdoors.

props.synopsis: The contraceptive Depo-Provera has been linked to an increased risk of developing a non-malignant brain tumour, prompting lawsuits in the US and Canada. Now Australian patients are considering a class action.

title.children: Popular contraceptive and endometriosis treatment linked to brain tumour

image.altText: man stands over a damaged hospital bed in kamal adwan hospital

props.synopsis: The Israel Defense Forces' latest raid on the crippled Kamal Adwan Hospital, and the detention of medical staff, leaves the facility out of operation.

title.children: Family fears for Gaza hospital boss as Israel claims arrest of Oct 7 attackers

image.altText: Black smoke emits from a plane on a runway

props.synopsis: Investigations continue into what caused Jeju Air flight JC-2216 to crash and explode at the end of a runway at a South Korean airport.

title.children: Two different scenarios could have caused the crash of Jeju Air flight JC-2216, experts say

image.altText: Two men, one younger, wearing black t-shirts.

props.synopsis: A young man killed in a rope swing accident on the Gold Coast has been remembered by his mentor as an emerging leader taken too soon.

title.children: Teen killed in rope swing accident remembered as 'angel taken too early'

image.altText: People gathered on steep embankments as a truck with red fencing is pulled out of a body of water

props.synopsis: Images from the crash scene released by local authorities appear to show first responders trying to pull the vehicle out of a river.

title.children: Ethiopian truck crash kills dozens returning from wedding

image.altText: large wave crashes into a score of boats in white water on the coastline of peru

props.synopsis: Ecuador's secretary for risk management described the incident as an "extreme event" and warned that more waves could be on the way.

title.children: Giant waves in Ecuador and Peru leave two dead and dozens more stranded

image.altText: Donald Trump wears a blue suit and red tie as he looks to his side while standing at a podium

props.synopsis: Few recent years have seen such dramatic changes as 2024 â changes that will resonate well into the future.

title.children: The geopolitical plates have shifted. We'll see fallout for years to come

image.altText: a man and woman carrying photos of a young man inside their home

props.synopsis: After a horror year for road fatalities in the Northern Territory, police and parents speak out about the disturbing reality behind the figures and call for caution on the roads.

title.children: Parents recount 'worst nightmare' after son dies in crash

image.altText: Ilaaf Hammoud wearing a beige hijab and jacket and white top in selfie

props.synopsis: Muslim women who choose to cover their hair have to consider modesty, privacy and gender when going to the salon.

title.children: What many Muslim women have to consider when looking for a hair salon

image.altText: 3 forensic officer dressed in blue walk up a street cordoned off by police

props.synopsis: Cheryl Lucas, 38, appears in Ballarat Magistrates Court, following the death of a 47-year-old man at a Mount Helen property on Saturday.

title.children: Ballarat woman appears in court charged with murder

image.altText: A barista wiping down a coffee machine in a cafe

props.synopsis: Australian bosses could go to jail for up to 10 years and be slapped with a $1.65 million fine if they "deliberately" underpay their workers, as part of new laws that take effect on January 1.

title.children: New laws that send bosses to jail for deliberate wage theft slammed as 'overreach'

image.altText: Picture of a hand with red laser lights behind it

props.synopsis: The economy of 2024 was incredibly uneven, spectacularly unfair and grinding in its relentlessness.

title.children: A 'winner-takes-all' economy where the young aren't invited to play

image.altText: Maggie Smith, wearing a purple shirt, on a blurred background.

props.synopsis: From a helicopter pilot-turned-janitor-turned-country star to a dancer who travelled the world and lived to 110, these men and women made their mark.

title.children: We lost some big names in 2024. Here are their stories

image.altText: A big fire.

props.synopsis: Fire authorities are hoping to have containment lines established around the Grampians National Park fire while the weather is favourable. Four homes have been confirmed lost in the blaze.

title.children: Fire crews tackling Grampians blaze 'blessed' with calmer conditions

image.altText: Police car outside of a sign of Amart in Rochedale.

props.synopsis: Police allege the man in his 40s threatened two officers with a knife on Brisbane's southside.

title.children: Man shot by police after allegedly threatening officers with knife in Brisbane

image.altText: An image of an Australian marathon runner at the Olympics, pictured from the waist up.

props.synopsis: School teacher Andy Buchanan learned a lot to become Australia's fastest marathon runner, but a powerful lesson came from a former AFL player in his classroom.

title.children: How Bendigo teacher Andy Buchanan ran fastest Aussie marathon time ever

image.altText: A man with a beard looks sideways

props.synopsis: Syria's de facto leader Ahmed al-Sharaa says elections in the country could take up to four years, citing a need to rewrite the constitution.Â

title.children: Syria election could take four years, de facto leader says

image.altText: Two woung people sitting on a couch with a small white dog.

props.synopsis: Experts say it is "wonderful" for people choosing to do house-sitting as a lifestyle to fulfil travel desires, but are worried what the rising trend might be hiding.Â

title.children: No rent, no bills: Young people are turning to house-sitting for the lifestyle

image.altText: A drone photo of a barge lowering concrete cylinders into shallow waters, forming an artificial reef.

props.synopsis: As communities across Australia battle coastal erosion, one council in WA is seeing promising results from a state-first artificial reef trial that is also helping marine life flourish.

title.children: WA-first artificial reef trial could help tackle coastal erosion nationwide

image.altText: a close-up of a person holding a glass under a running tap, filling it with water

props.synopsis: Expecting to need another water source by the end of next decade, Canberra's water authority is considering whether the city will need to supplement the drinking water supply with purified treated sewage water in the future.

title.children: ACT authorities consider supplementing drinking water with treated sewage water

image.altText: Two bolts of lightning pictured over Kununurra at night

props.synopsis: "Mango madness" and "going troppo" are embedded in the Australian vernacular â as the weather starts to heat up, people act out. But is there any truth to the idea?

title.children: The data says you really can 'go troppo'

image.altText: a river with a warning sign

props.synopsis: The man was swimming in the Murrumbidgee River at Pine Island with family and friends when he experienced trouble in the water and failed to resurface on Sunday afternoon.Â

title.children: 21-year-old man drowns at popular Canberra river swimming spot

image.altText: A brunette woman is holding her young daughter, standing in a crop of early cotton.

props.synopsis: Farmer and agronomist Ashlee Johnston had to juggle early mornings, late nights and 300km of travel each day if she wanted child care for her daughter. Then locals took action.

title.children: When their only childcare centre closed, this small town built its own
